content: also that can be where you can embroider a name followed by more welts attach the hanging loop changing colors at this point makes the transition smoother folded cuff method 1 work the cuff inside-out in reverse stockinette purl side out knit side in for the cuff then when you are ready leg to fold the cuff and start the leg switch to working knit on the outside and purl on the inside work this under-cuff portion the work any of the charts in any order or color sequence you like same length as the cuff before beginning leg patterns make the leg as long as you like i worked as many row as you see on a page of the chart because that s what fits on the page folded cuff method 2 this may be the easier way if your cuff has a complicated stitch pattern knit the cuff right side out when the start of the round becomes the middle back of the stocking you re ready to start the leg turn the cuff inside out slip a stitch 2 i recommend working only two colors at a time and embroidering work the foot section in patterns of your choice until it is about two any additional colors in duplicate stitch definitely embroider the thirds the length of the leg section now get ready to start the toe reindeer in duplicate stitch also probably the little houses and toe birds unless they are all to be the same color reserving heel placement at start of round center back of stocking round 1 k15 k2tog k1 place marker k1 ssk k30 k2tog k1 these stockings use an afterthought heel which means that the heel place marker k1 ssk k15 4 sts decreased 68 sts on will be temporarily bypassed and worked after the rest of the needles stocking including toe is done it s nice to put a welt just before and after the heel placement round 2 knit you will reserve the place where the heel goes by knitting halfway round 3 k to 3 sts before first marker k2 decrease k2 ssk k to 3 sts around the sock with some scrap yarn which later will be pulled out before second marker k2 decrease k2 ssk k to end of so the heel can be worked from the surrounding stitches round 4 sts decreased drop working yarns beginning at the middle back of the stocking repeat rnds 2 and 3 until 36 sts remain beginning of the round cut your yarns drop them and leave them to be woven in when the stocking is finished do not weave repeat just round 3 until 16 sts remain them in along with the scrap yarn or carry them to be worked after finishing toe graft remaining sts with kitchner stitch or repeat round 3 the scrap yarn the heel will be inserted where the scrap yarn is two more times and cinch up the remaining 8 sts back
